result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon L. Wilson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: --to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge , plus $33 in subpoena fees

--no acts or threats of violence
--to participate in a Batterers Treatment Program, preferably a group program and preferably a certified program
--to under anger management counseling and therapies as required by the Agent
--to take the Incredible Years Parenting Class through the Human Services Department, or another similar parenting class that is approved by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to comply with the treatment recommendations of the Compass in the order deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--no contact with April Bruschnig except as authorized by the Juvenile Court Order, or as authorized by the Agent after the expiration of the Juvenile Court Order
--no contact with April Brushnig's child or her minor children with Mr. Wilson together, except as authorized by the Juvenile Court Order, or as approved by the Agent after the expiration of the Juvenile Court Order
--no contact with the unborn child that Mr. Wilson may have Ajia Demetropoulos except as the Agent may authorize upon the paternity adjudication, and in court for paternity adjudication
--not to provide care for any other minor children 
--to submit to random alchol and drug screening
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
The Court finds that Mr. Wilson is not eligible for SAP or ERP, if Probation is revoked.

Arresting Agency: WTPD

  If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--to serve six months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence forthwith
---Mr. Wilson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.

supervisions.notes: The Court orders that any court-ordered financial amounts owed are to be reduced to civil judgments.

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Wilson to  4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to commence forhwith. 

Mr. Wilson indicates that the DNA sample provision was already accomplished.

Statute 941.291 body armor prohibition imposed; penalties recited

**Per Court's 12/10/18 Order: Amend JOC to add 1 day credit.**

records.addlTxt:
[MK] case called at 9:05am.
Defendant Brandon L. Wilson in court, in custody, with Attorney Elizabeth F Svehlek.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance.
Sentencing arguments are given by ADA Teuber, by Attorney Svehlek.
Statement given by Mr. Wilson. 

On Count #2, the Court sentences Mr. Wilson to  4  years, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of  2  years, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of  2 years.  This sentence is to commence forhwith. 

The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program "Boot Camp".
The Court finds that the Defendant is not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
The Court gives 359 days credit for time already served.
The Court orders that any court-ordered financial amounts owed are to be reduced to civil judgments. 

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--no acts or threats of violence 
--to participate in and successfully complete a Batterers Treatment program, preferrably a group program, and preferrably a certified program
--to undergo anger management counseling and therapies as required by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of alcohol 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to take prescribed medications only as prescribed
--to undergo AODA assessment if required by the Agent, and to follow through with any recommended treatment
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, or counseling as required by the Agent
--no contact with April Bruschnig 
--no contact with April Bruschnig's child [who is not the child of Mr. Wilson] 
--no contact with the minor children that Mr. Wilson and Ms. Bruschnig have together except as approved by the Agent
--no contact with Kelly Ramsey
--not to provide care for any other minor children
--to submit to random alcohol and drug screening 


Mr. Wilson indicates that the DNA sample provision was already accomplished.
Contact prohibition violation warnings given/penalties recited.  
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Statute 941.291 body armor prohibition imposed; penalties recited
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form is given to the Defendant
recess 9:45am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 3, 2017 at 09:00 am.

**Off Record**
The Court reschedules the Sentencing After Revocation Hearing due to Attorney Svehlek being unavailable. Case will be rescheduled to 2/28/17 at 9:30 am.
Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 17, 2017 at 10:00 am.

Courts orders Defendants exhibit #2 & States exhibit #3 be scanned sealed

records.addlTxt:
case called at 10:35am. (SM, then MK from 11:55am to end)
Defendant Brandon L. Wilson in court, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber. 
The victim/victim's mother A.B. gives a statement.
ADA Teuber submits State's Exhibit #1: a disc continuing the recording of the interview with Mr. Wilson; the video recording is played until the recording is stopped at 2 hours 35 seconds.
Sentencing arguments given by Attorney De La Rosa.  
Attorney De La Rosa submits Childrens Hospital medical records excerpts, marked as Defendant's Exhibit #2. 
Recess 11:59am, Reconvene 12:05pm. 
ADA Teuber submits additional Childrens Hospital medical records excerpts, marked as State's Exhibit #3. 
Further arguments given by Attorney De La Rosa.
Mr. Wilson makes a statement.


On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence and places Mr. Wilson on Probation for three years, with conditions:
--to serve six months in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence forthwith
---Mr. Wilson is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his system; non-compliance will result in loss of work-release privileges without further process.
--no acts or threats of violence
--to participate in a Batterers Treatment Program, preferrably a group program and preferrably a certified program
--to under anger management counseling and therapies as required by the Agent
--to take the Incredible Years Parenting Class through the Human Services Department, or another similar parenting class that is approved by the Agent
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or ingestion of controlled substances without a valid prescription
--to comply with the treatment recommendations of the Compass in the order deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment, counseling as required by the Agent
--no contact with April Bruschnig except as authorized by the Juvenile Court Order, or as authorized by the Agent after the expiration of the Juvenile Court Order
--no contact with April Brushnig's child or her minor children with Mr. Wilson together, except as authorized by the Juvenile Court Order, or as approved by the Agent after the expiration of the Juvenile Court Order
--no contact with the unborn child that Mr. Wilson may have Ajia Demetropoulos except as the Agent may authorize upon the paternity adjudication, and in court for paternity adjudication
--not to provide care for any other minor children 
--to submit to random alchol and drug screening
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to comply with DNA sample provision 
--to pay costs of $268 plus $250 DNA surcharge, plus $33 in subpoena fees

The Court gives 49 days credit for time already served.

The Court finds that Mr. Wilson is not eligible for SAP or ERP, if Probation is revoked. 
Body Armor prohibition/warnings given
Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Contact prohibition warnings/penalties given.
recess 12:51pm.

cases #14CF43, #14CF383, and #14CF387 called at 11:23am. [MK]
Defendant Brandon L. Wilson in court with Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
[Initial Appearance conducted in Cases #14CF383 and #14CF387. Recess as to Cases #14CF383 and #14CF387 only at 11:28am]

ADA Teuber files Motions in Limine, a Motion to Impeach with a Prior Conviction, Proposed Jury Instructions, a Notice to Admit Statements, and a Witness List. 
ADA Teuber indicates that the State is prepared to proceed to Jury Trial as scheduled later this week and that the witnesses are available. ADA Teuber has a meeting scheduled with the medical witnesses in preparation for trial. 
The Court grants the State's Motion to Impeach the Defendant with a prior conviction. 
In response to the Court's inquiry regarding the Motions in Limine, Attorney De La Rosa indicates that from his preliminary review the motions, they look straightforward; he will further review the motions, but at this point he has no objection to them 
As to State's intended photo exhibits, Attorney De La Rosa requests that the State have them prepared so that he can review the number and content of them at the time that trial is commencing 
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that the Defense position on the State's intended statement being presented as an exception to the hearsay ruleis that, if it involves facts that were presented to the doctor as part of trying to make a diagnosis, then those meet the exception.  The Court indicates that the Defense is to voice any objection at the time the statement is being offered
ADA Teuber orally motions to prohibit the Defense from referencing the child's current status;  the Court instructs ADA Teuber to raise any objections as an issue arises.
The Court intends to carry two additional jurors; each party will have six strikes during jury selection. 
The Court requires Attorney De La Rosa to file any proposed Jury Instructions by eob tomorrow, otherwise the Court will rely on the State's submitted proposed Jury Instructions.
The Court sets 9:00am on November 12th as the deadline for any change of plea or other case resolution. 
recess 11:46am 


NEXT:  Jury Trial will proceed on November 13th at 8:30am; the jury panel is to be prepared to begin the jury selection process at 8:45am.
Jury trial on November 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on November 10, 2014 at 11:00 am.

[Clerk: MK]
case called at 9:27am. 
Attorney Jeffrey J De La Rosa.  ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that he anticipated Defendant Brandon Wilson appearing today.  Attorney De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Wilson has been in good contact, including that they had a recent office meeting.   Attorney De La Rosa tried calling Mr. Wilson shortly before the hearing, but the voice recording he got makes it appear that there is a cellular network issue.
The Court orders issuance of a bench warrant, but the Court will not sign it until noon today, to allow time for Attorney De La Rosa to reach Mr. Wilson and appear.
recess 9:29am, reconvene 9:35am.  Mr. Wilson now appears.
Attorney De La Rosa indicates that no resolution of the case; he requests that the trial be scheduled in November so that he has time to do further discovery and interview witnesses.
The Court indicates that it will schedule the trial in November, but instructs ADA Beck that the State should contact the medical professional-witnesses as soon as the trial dates are known, to make sure they are available on the scheduled dates.
Mr. Wilson verifies that he still lives at the Clyman Street address.
recess 9:39am. 

NEXT:  schedule FSSC and two-day length Jury Trial in November

Case called at 1:15 pm
Defendant Brandon L. Wilson in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews procedural posture of the case.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant appeared on 1/21/14 but there was no complaint filed at that time.
Court charges the clerk with making sure the minutes and bond from 14GF51 for the 1/21/14 hearing make it to the Court file.
Service of Complaint admitted; reading waived; charges and maximum penalties recited
Court reviews criminal complaint and finds that it states probable cause to support Count #1 & #2.
Court makes a record that the defendant made an appearance at the Jefferson County Courthouse on a different matter on 2/25/14 at 2:00 pm the same day that that he was to be in court in front of Judge Weston.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.
Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that the defendant was in court on 2/25/14 at 2:00 pm in Br. 3, and he was unaware that he had a hearing in Br. 1 at 1:00 on that day. Defendant provided his updated address after the 1/21/14 hearing to the Watertown PD instead of the Jefferson County Clerk of Court.
Attorney Svehlek provides updated address to the Court.

Court requires $20,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No contact with RBW (DOB: 8/9/13), JPB (DOB: 5/3/06), KMW (DOB: 10/25/10), MLW (DOB: 8/22/12) or April Bruschnig
-No contact at any residences occupied by April Bruschnig or any of the children
-Defendant must check in with the DA's Office receptionist on 4/2/14 no later than 10:40 am for the Pretrial Conference. 

Preliminary Hearing time limits waived by both parties.

Recess: 1:36 pm
NEXT: (Notices to be mailed)
PTC: 4/2/14 at 10:40 am
Preliminary Hearing: to be set (State requests the Prelim. be set shortly after the PTC)

**Minutes from 14GF51  Bail Bond Hearing**
Case called at 2:28 pm
Brandon L. Wilson appears in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail with Attorney Elizabeth Svehlek from the Jefferson County Public Defenders Office. ADA Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Svehlek informs the Court that they have not received a copy of the probable cause statement.
recess: 2:29 pm to allow time for Clerk to fax a copy of the probable cause statement to the defendant at the Jefferson County Jail
reconvene: 2:34 pm
Court enters case 14GF51 into case number field on the probable cause statement.
Court reviewed the Probable Cause Statement and found that it stated probable cause.
Court verifies with the Defendant that the DOB listed on the probable cause is correct.
ADA Teuber informs the Court she is awaiting more reports and requests 30 days to file a complaint.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires $5,000.00 signature bond, with conditions: 
-No acts or threats of violence
-No contact with RBW (DOB: 8/9/13), JPB (DOB: 5/3/06), KMW (DOB: 10/25/10), MLW (DOB 8/22/12) or April Bruschnig
-No contact at any residences occupied by April Bruschnig or any of the children; except may return to the residence to one occassion with law enforcement to obtain personal belongings

Attorney Svehlek reviews protective plan.
Court grants the State 30 days to file a complaint.

Recess: 2:50 pm
